title: Fix role-based access control implementation errors

requirements.text: Fix UserRole type definition in backend/migration.mo to use correct Motoko variant syntax with #Admin and #Viewer constructor tags instead of plain identifiers

quotes: Type definition issues with the UserRole enum in Motoko

acceptanceCriteria: UserRole type in backend/migration.mo uses proper variant syntax: type UserRole = {#Admin; #Viewer;}
No compilation errors related to UserRole type definition

requirements.text: Fix requireAdmin() function in backend/main.mo to use correct pattern matching syntax for UserRole variant, checking for #Admin tag and throwing descriptive error for unauthorized access
acceptanceCriteria: requireAdmin() correctly pattern matches on UserRole variant using switch statement or case expression
Function throws error with message 'Unauthorized: Admin role required' when caller has #Viewer role
Function allows execution to continue when caller has #Admin role

requirements.text: Fix requireAuthenticated() function in backend/main.mo to properly validate caller has a valid UserProfile with any role (#Admin or #Viewer) and throw error if profile does not exist
acceptanceCriteria: requireAuthenticated() retrieves caller's UserProfile from stable storage
Function throws error with message 'Unauthorized: Authentication required' when profile is null or missing
Function allows execution to continue when valid profile exists with any role

requirements.text: Implement stable storage migration logic in backend/migration.mo to safely add role field to existing UserProfile records, defaulting all existing profiles to #Admin role for backward compatibility

quotes: Stable storage migration issues when adding the new role field to existing UserProfile records

acceptanceCriteria: Migration function checks if UserProfile records exist without role field
All existing UserProfile records are updated with role field set to #Admin
Migration preserves all other UserProfile data (name, department, principal)
New UserProfile records use the role value provided during creation

requirements.text: Ensure type consistency between UserRole and UserProfile definitions in both backend/main.mo and backend/migration.mo, using identical type signatures

quotes: Type consistency between main.mo and migration.mo

acceptanceCriteria: UserRole type definition is identical in both backend/main.mo and backend/migration.mo
UserProfile type definition is identical in both files including the role field type
No type mismatch compilation errors between main actor and migration module

requirements.text: Fix createUserProfile mutation in backend/main.mo to correctly accept role parameter as UserRole variant (#Admin or #Viewer) from frontend and save it to UserProfile record

quotes: Ensure the createUserProfile mutation in backend/main.mo properly handles the role parameter

acceptanceCriteria: createUserProfile function signature includes role parameter of type UserRole
Function correctly stores the role value in the UserProfile record
No type conversion errors when saving UserRole variant to stable storage

requirements.text: Verify all mutation operations in backend/main.mo (createProductionEntry, updateProductionEntry, deleteProductionEntry, createDispatchEntry, updateDispatchStatus, createDailyProductionReport, updateDailyProductionReport, updateDailyProductionReportById) call requireAdmin() at the start of their function bodies with proper error propagation

quotes: Proper error handling for authorization failures

acceptanceCriteria: Each mutation function calls requireAdmin() as the first statement
Authorization errors are properly propagated to the caller
Functions return appropriate error responses when authorization fails

constraints: Maintain single-actor architecture with all logic in backend/main.mo
Preserve all existing stable storage data during migration
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts or frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts
Ensure backward compatibility with existing UserProfile records
nonGoals: Adding new authorization roles beyond Admin and Viewer
Adding audit logging for authorization failures
Changing the frontend role selection UI
